page.title: 08FARMING continued
page.content:
Mr Houghton's crops consist of: a) Rhubarb - this is planted at any time of the year, left 4/5 years and then picked. Replanting is not necessary for ten years. Harvesting is done July to October. b) Apples - there is a small orchard. c) Peas - these are grown for their high protein content and are sold to manufacturers who make different types of high protein food.
The l6 acres are sown in April and harvested in October. These are sold in the farm shop and also on a pick your own basis. There are 7l acres of land on Cold Harbour Farm but the total of all four farms is 350 acres. Mr Houghton has a farm secretary who comes once a month but he manages the farm himself. He employs 4 workers.
